title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that several spells of showers will occur in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Nearly 3,000 armed forces deserters arrested
byline: A total of 2,983 soldiers, including officers, who deserted from the Tri-Forces have been arrested, according to the Ministry of Defence.

title: 16-year-old  dies from electrocution in Madurankuli
byline: A 16-year-old has died after being electrocuted at a residence in Madurankuli, Sameeragama, according to Sri Lanka Police.

title: Shooting attempt reported in Panadura
byline: A shooting attempt has been reported in the Gemunu Mawatha area of Walana, Panadura, at around 8 a.m. this morning (June 2), police said.

title: LG bodies to be formed under new Mayors and Chairpersons today
byline: The activities of 161 local government institutions will officially commence today (June 2).

title: Man attacks Colorado crowd with firebombs, 6 people injured
byline: Six people were injured on Sunday when a 45-year-old man yelled “Free Palestine” and threw incendiary devices into a crowd in Boulder, Colorado where a demonstration to remember the Israeli hostages who remain in Gaza was taking place, authorities said.

title: Piyal Kumara wins ‘Derana 60 Plus - Season 6’
byline: The grand finale of Sri Lanka’s first and only reality show for senior citizens, ‘Derana 60 Plus - Season 6’, was held on June 1 in a grand manner.

title: National Tax Week begins today under the theme ‘Badhu Shakthi’
byline: The ‘National Tax Week’ begins today (June 2).

title: “Pay your taxes, and we’ll protect every rupee” – President Anura Kumara
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced that he has taken measures to reduce expenditure under the President’s budget wherever possible, with the aim of safeguarding every rupee of public funds.

title: Two teen girls drown in Pillaiyar Kovil pond
byline: ‘Ada Derana’ has received CCTV footage showing two 15-year-old girls drowning in a pond at a Kovil in the Pillaiyar area of Mullaitivu while taking photographs.

title: Finance Secretary Mahinda Siriwardena to retire and take up ADB post
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake announced that the incumbent Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Mahinda Siriwardena, will retire from his position at the end of this month.

title: Mumbai locomotives among 32 engines sent to Sri Lanka
byline: Five of the 32 locomotives selected for export to Sri Lanka, following a formal request by the neighbouring country, are from Mumbai.

title: Bus accident at Norton Bridge due to mechanical failure
byline: A Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) bus travelling from Colombo to Maskeliya was involved in an accident at around 8.30 this morning (June 2), Norton Bridge Police said.

title: NPP-SJB tussle over Colombo Mayor post continues; Ind. members’ support key
byline: Both the government led by the National People’s Power (NPP) and the opposition led by the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) continue to stake their claim to the post of Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: Former NLB Director Thusitha Halloluwa further remanded
byline: Former Executive Director of the National Lotteries Board (NLB), Thusitha Halloluwa, has been further remanded until Wednesday (June 4), said Ada Derana reporter.

title: Polish nationalist Nawrocki wins presidency in setback for pro-EU government
byline: Nationalist opposition candidate Karol Nawrocki narrowly won Poland’s presidential election, results showed on Monday, delivering a major blow to the centrist government’s efforts to cement Warsaw’s pro-European orientation.

title: Electricity (Amendment) Bill challenged in Supreme Court
byline: The Electricity (Amendment) Bill, which was presented in Parliament by the government recently has been challenged in the Supreme Court.

title: LG Polls: Appeals Court issues injunction on Kekirawa Returning Officer
byline: The Court of Appeal has issued an interim injunction suspending the enforcement of a letter issued by the Returning Officer of Kekirawa requesting the appointment of female councilors to the seats won under the proportional representation system by the SJB at the Local Government election for the Kekirawa Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: Ex-chairman of Lindula-Talawakelle UC Asoka Sepala arrested
byline: Former chairman of the Lindula-Talawakelle Urban Council, Asoka Sepala has been arrested for causing a loss of Rs. 2.38 million to the government.

title: Australia’s Deputy PM to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence of Australia, Richard Marles, will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka tomorrow (June 3).

title: Suba Umathevan represents Sri Lanka in historic world record song for gender equality
byline: The Frequency School has broken the GUINNESS WORLD RECORDS™ title for the “Most nationalities to contribute vocals to a musical recording (single song)” with the song “195”, which features voices from all 195 countries recognized by the United Nations — including a proud contribution from Sri Lanka.

title: Appeals Court issues interim order against Magistrate’s ruling
byline: The Court of Appeal today (June 2) issued an interim injunction suspending the implementation of a notice issued by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, which had directed officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to appear before the Magistrate’s Court tomorrow (June 3).

title: SC to hear FR filed against ex-Minister Fowzie in November
byline: The Supreme Court today (02) ordered that a fundamental rights petition filed naming former Minister A. H. M. Fowzie as a respondent be taken up for consideration on November 4.

title: Olympian Sriyani Kulawansa named chairperson of National Sports Selection Committee
byline: Olympian and Women’s 100m hurdles Sri Lanka record holder Sriyani Kulawansa has been appointed as the chairperson of the National Sports Selection Committee (NSSC).

title: 34 dead in four days in India’s northeast after heavy floods
byline: At least 34 people have died in India’s northeastern region after heavy floods caused landslides over the last four days, authorities and media said on Monday, and the weather department predicted more heavy rain.

title: China donates 5 int’l-standard dragon boats to Sri Lanka
byline: In a gesture of sports diplomacy and cultural exchange, the Chinese Embassy in Sri Lanka has donated five 12-person international-standard dragon boats to Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports.

title: Women’s Emerging Teams Asia Cup postponed over weather and health issues in Sri Lanka
byline: The 2025 Women’s Emerging Teams Asia Cup, originally set to begin from June 6 in Sri Lanka, has been postponed due to adverse weather and health concerns in the country, said the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) on Monday.
